results.title: In the Wild Tale of ‘Cocaine Bear,’ an Apex Predator Is the True Star
results.abstract: The horror-comedy is based on a real story from 1985, but the director Elizabeth Banks and writer Jimmy Warden gave their furry lead a different ending.

multimedia.caption: The true star of “Cocaine Bear” was computer-generated. The director Elizabeth Banks and her crew affectionately called him Cokey.

results.title: Delbert Anderson’s Mission: Putting ‘Native Sound Back Into Jazz’
results.abstract: The trumpeter’s trio takes inspiration from traditional Navajo songs. Its work has stirred up global interest, as well as conversations about the responsibilities of Indigenous artists.

results.title: This Year, the Berlin Film Festival Sparkles
results.abstract: After two years of pandemic disruptions, the festival returns in full, with Kristen Stewart as the jury president and gems like Celine Song’s “Past Lives.”

results.title: On Broadway, ‘Bad Cinderella’ Is a Rebel With a Brooklyn Accent
results.abstract: Linedy Genao brings her whole Latina self to Andrew Lloyd Webber’s new musical, which also stars the stage veteran Carolee Carmello as her evil stepmother.

multimedia.caption: In “Bad Cinderella,” Carolee Carmello, left, plays the evil stepmother, and Linedy Genao, right, is the rebellious title character. They both found their way to the stage after earning business degrees.
multimedia.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.title: A Dave Brubeck Cantata Boasts Star Soloists: His Sons
results.abstract: “The Gates of Justice,” a large-scale 1969 choral work about relations between Black and Jewish Americans, is being performed in Los Angeles.

multimedia.caption: From left: Dan, Chris and Darius Brubeck are for the first time forming the central trio in “The Gates of Justice,” a 1969 cantata about race and religion by their father, the jazz eminence Dave Brubeck.
multimedia.copyright: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: From left: Dan, Chris and Darius Brubeck are for the first time forming the central trio in “The Gates of Justice,” a 1969 cantata about race and religion by their father, the jazz eminence Dave Brubeck.

results.title: ‘Mama, I Want to Sing!’ Returns for 40th Anniversary

results.title: How Well Do You Know These Page-Turners Set in Washington, D.C.?
results.abstract: Along with its memorials and monuments, the nation’s capital has been a frequent location for many spine-tingling novels. Take this week’s quiz to see how many plots and places you recognize!

results.title: Ricardo Darín: Argentina’s Lucky Charm at the Oscars
results.abstract: When the country has a nominated film, it has usually starred this veteran. But the actor says other people have believed in his talent more than he has.

results.title: In ‘The Quiet Girl,’ an Irish Loneliness Rarely Seen Onscreen
results.abstract: The first Irish-language film to be nominated for an Oscar, directed by Colm Bairéad, tells a gentle story of cultural reticence.

multimedia.caption: In “The Quiet Girl,” Catherine Clinch plays Cáit, who is shuttled from her chaotic family home to live with relatives for the summer.

results.title: Tina Barney: The Photographer’s Origin Story
results.abstract: With a show at Kasmin and a new book of rediscovered photographs, both called “The Beginning,” the ethnographer of the elite reflects on finding her voice.

multimedia.caption: Tina Barney’s self-portrait, 2023, in her Watch Hill, R.I. home, taken with her 8-by-10-inch view camera. She finds still-lifes at her home a relief; she doesn’t have to chase people to get them to pose.

results.title: A Publishing Superstar Whose Memoir Shuns Glitz to Explore Private Torment
results.abstract: In “The Absent Moon,” Luiz Schwarcz, a legendary Brazilian publisher and global tastemaker, shares little of the glamorous life, focusing instead on the lifelong pain of clinical depression.
des_facet: The Absent Moon: A Memoir of a Short Childhood and a Long Depression (Book)

multimedia.caption: “When I wrote the book, I said that it was for helping others,” says Luiz Schwarcz of his memoir. “Then I realized it’s mainly for me.”
multimedia.copyright: Victor Moriyama for The New York Times

results.title: MacDowell Names Chiwoniso Kaitano Its Next Executive Director
results.abstract: Kaitano, the first Black person in the role at the artists’ residency, will focus on identifying underrepresented artistic voices and intensifying outreach.

multimedia.caption: Chiwoniso Kaitano will take over as MacDowell’s executive director in March, replacing Philip Himberg.

results.title: ‘We Have a Ghost’ Review: Me and My Boo
results.abstract: David Harbour stars as an apparition haunting a family’s home in this supernatural Netflix comedy.

multimedia.caption: In “We Have a Ghost,” a father (Anthony Mackie) and son (Jahi Winston) have opposing ideas on what to do about the ghost (David Harbour) in the house.

results.title: Hogwarts Legacy Sells 12 Million Copies During Dispute Over Rowling
results.abstract: The video game generated $850 million in sales in two weeks. Online discussion before its release was largely about the “Harry Potter” creator J.K. Rowling’s comments on transgender issues.

multimedia.caption: Hogwarts Legacy was released for computers, the PlayStation 5 and the Xbox Series X and Series S. It will come out for older consoles in April and July.
Hogwarts Legacy was released for computers, the PlayStation 5 and the Xbox Series X and Series S. It will come out for older consoles in April and July.

results.title: Linda King Newell, Feminist Scholar of Mormon History, Dies at 82
results.abstract: Her work exploring the idea of female subservience within the church won acclaim. But it also led to her being blacklisted by Mormon leaders.
des_facet: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)

multimedia.caption: Linda King Newell in 1985. She argued that Mormon women had once held significant power, but that they were sidelined as the church became more bureaucratic.
Linda King Newell in 1985. She argued that Mormon women had once held significant power, but that they were sidelined as the church became more bureaucratic.
Linda King Newell in 1985. She argued that Mormon women had once held significant power, but that they were sidelined as the church became more bureaucratic.

results.title: Overlooked No More: Clara Driscoll, Designer of Visions in Glass for Tiffany
results.abstract: She oversaw the Tiffany girls, a group of glass cutters and artisans who created elaborate, colorful lamps that are still in demand.

multimedia.caption: The designer Clara Driscoll around 1900. The New-York Historical Society’s museum has about 100 Tiffany lamps on view, 63 of which are attributed to her.
multimedia.copyright: Courtesy of Linda D. Alexander and David Fenn

results.title: Alec Baldwin Pleads Not Guilty to Involuntary Manslaughter
results.abstract: Baldwin was holding a gun on the set of the film “Rust” when it discharged, killing the movie’s cinematographer. The movie’s armorer made her first virtual court appearance on Friday.

multimedia.caption: Alec Baldwin was also a producer on “Rust,” which is scheduled to continue filming in Montana this spring.
Alec Baldwin was also a producer on “Rust,” which is scheduled to continue filming in Montana this spring.

results.title: A New ‘Lohengrin,’ Threatened by War in Ukraine, Comes to the Met
results.abstract: François Girard’s staging, originally a co-production with the Bolshoi Theater, arrives a year after its Moscow premiere, which coincided with Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

multimedia.caption: Piotr Beczala as the title character in Wagner’s “Lohengrin” at the Metropolitan Opera. The production’s scenery had to be rebuilt from scratch; the originals could not leave Russia because of U.S. sanctions in response to the war in Ukraine.

Piotr Beczala as the title character in Wagner’s “Lohengrin” at the Metropolitan Opera. The production’s scenery had to be rebuilt from scratch; the originals could not leave Russia because of U.S. sanctions in response to the war in Ukraine.

results.title: Algiers Blasts Songs of Damage and Redemption on ‘Shook’
results.abstract: On its fourth album, the Atlanta band welcomes guest voices and pushes itself even harder.

multimedia.caption: Portents of apocalypse and furious resistance have coursed through the music of the Atlanta-based Algiers since its 2015 debut.
Portents of apocalypse and furious resistance have coursed through the music of the Atlanta-based Algiers since its 2015 debut.
